thread.title: Lion Ambassadors throw 162nd birthday party for Penn State
thread.title_full: Lion Ambassadors throw 162nd birthday party for Penn State

author: Abbi Sales | The Daily Collegian
title: Lion Ambassadors throw 162nd birthday party for Penn State
text:
Buy Now Max Petrosky 
Mike ‘The Mailman’ Herr serves ice cream to Melissa Maskal (senior-nutritional science) during the Founder’s Day celebration hosted by the Lion Ambassadors in the HUB-Robeson Center on Wednesday, Feb. 22, 2017. Lion Ambassadors throw 162nd birthday party for Penn State Buy Now Max Petrosky 
Mike ‘The Mailman’ Herr serves ice cream to Melissa Maskal (senior-nutritional science) during the Founder’s Day celebration hosted by the Lion Ambassadors in the HUB-Robeson Center on Wednesday, Feb. 22, 2017. 
There's no party like a Penn State birthday party. 
The Lion Ambassadors hosted its annual Founder's Day celebration in the HUB-Robeson Center to wish Penn State a happy 162nd birthday. 
The celebration included music, free cake, Berkey Creamery ice cream and cookies along with performances and special appearances from the Nittany Lion and Mike "the Mailman" Herr. 
"Founder's Day brings the kids together to celebrate Penn State's birthday," Herr said. "Penn State is a big family." 
Mike the Mailman served up ice cream and smiles to the students in the HUB and said during his time working at Penn State he was a good listener and is glad he made a positive impact on the students. 
He also said it was really special and touched him that he was a part of the THON 2017 line dance. 
"I'm still happy to be a part of the community," Herr said. "I didn't have the time to do these things while I was working but now I can." 
On the first floor of the HUB there was a photo booth, Penn State trivia, pin the tail on Old Coaly, Penn State history from the Centre Country Historical Society and 'What do you want for Penn State's birthday?' 
"You always get asked 'how old are you?' and 'what do you want for your birthday?'," Lion Ambassador's executive vice president Katy Leslie said. "So far people have made suggestions from jet pack classes to microwaves in the HUB. At the end of the day, we're going to pick the best ones and send them to 'What To Fix UPUA.'" 
Leslie (senior-supply chain management) said her favorite part of the celebration, besides the free food, was the Nittany Lion and Mike the Mailman making their appearances. 
Victoria Herr said what she wants for Penn State's birthday is more football. 
"I really love Penn State," Victoria Herr (sophomore-agricultural and extension education) said. "It makes me excited to answer trivia and win free stuff." 
Herr said her favorite part of Penn State is the atmosphere. 
"I've never felt alone," she said. "We're a big family."
